questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the tools from the left onto the tool's function on the right. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which CI solution uses this file?

discussion.content:
Wonder should A. Drone be the correct answer

syntax for GitLab CI, Travis CI & Jenkins are "stage...", while Drone use "steps..."

Here are the configuration files I referred
https://docs.drone.io/pipeline/environment/syntax/
https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/yaml/includes.html
https://blog.travis-ci.com/2019-05-30-setting-up-a-ci-cd-process-on-github
https://www.jenkins.io/doc/pipeline/examples/

comments.content:
This is the most correct, The general lifecycle is Develop -> Build -> Test -> Deploy -> Monitor
Develop: would have the commit action
Build: includes Unit & Integration testing along with artifact creation
Test: would by UAT and staging deployment
Deploy: would be rolling into production

The merge into mainline triggers the CD piece

discussion.content:
developer commits
unit testing
integration testing
merging of commit into mainline
generating deliverables
starting of rolling deployment

This one is confusing, but I believe "generating deliverables" should be step 1, which is the "Plan" stage that comes before the "Develop" stage. If it had said "generating aritfacts" then I would place it at step 5.

comments.content: you would never merge the commit to mainline unless the tests are green. Tests must run before merge.

According to the article at https://dzone.com/articles/testing-in-cicd, It describe as following. I think... 
1. unit testing
2. developer commits
3. integration testing
4. merging of commit into mainline
5. generating deliverables
6. starting of rolling deployment
According to official Cisco training documentation, Unit Testing is performed as part of the CI/CD process and not on the developer side. This means the commit must occur before the unit testing.

discussion.content:
Although it's not clear, but as I think, 
1. developer commits
2. merging of commit into mainline
3. unit testing
4. integration testing
5. generating deliverables
6. starting of rolling deployment

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the operations from the left into the correct order on the right when using CI/CD, assuming that there are no failures or conflicts.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

choices.C: Drill down to investigate and identify the errors
choices.B: Log in to the node directly and investigate the errors by reviewing log files
choices.A: Rewrite the SQL query identified in the transaction to be more efficient

discussion.content:
Agree that B should be the answer

Since the database(with the cross on its icon) is yet not visible by AppDynamics and direct login for further check is needed.

table lists the different database icons
https://docs.appdynamics.com/appd/23.x/latest/en/application-monitoring/remote-services/monitor-databases

Selected Answer: B
B seems to be the best answer, but ... the whole thing is nonsense.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A developer is creating a script to test APIs. The Cisco Webex API and a CI/CD pipeline are tested to ensure that the script runs without problems. The script is executed without issues locally, but the CI/CD system returns the error shown. What is the problem with the script?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The CI/CD system needs to download/install the dependency. The import is done within the code correctly.

choices.C: The version of Python is wrong in the CI/CD pipeline
choices.A: The CI/CD system is configured incorrectly to import the dependencies to the code
choices.B: The code is pushed incorrectly to the CI/CD system
choices.D: The CI/CD system is configured incorrectly to download the required dependencies
